Class Evaluator

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
IExpressionEvaluator
public class Evaluator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExpressionEvaluator
Takes a string and convert it to its float value

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Evaluator()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String checkNegBrackets​(java.lang.String myString)
    It takes the string (infix) and validate if there are negative brackets it solves this problem using dummy zeros
    int evaluate​(java.lang.String expression)
    Evaluate a postfix numeric expression,with a single space separator it throws exception if the method validatePostfix is false and in case of division by zero
    float getValue​(java.lang.String s)  
    java.lang.String infixToPostfix​(java.lang.String expression)
    Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to postfix notation.there is no assumption on spaces between terms or the length of the term(e.g.,two digits symbolic or numeric term)
    boolean validatePostfix​(java.lang.String s)
    Takes the postfix and validate it it is called in the evaluate method it validates that before each operation there is space and after eack operation there is space except if the operation at the end of the string in this case it is valid if there is no space after it and also to be valid postfix the number of operations should be less the number of terms
    boolean validateString​(java.lang.String s)
    Takes the string after we removed spaces in the infix form and validate it after we have solved problem of negative numbers and negative brackets using dummy zeros

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • validatePostfix

      public boolean validatePostfix​(java.lang.String s)
      Takes the postfix and validate it it is called in the evaluate method it validates that before each operation there is space and after eack operation there is space except if the operation at the end of the string in this case it is valid if there is no space after it and also to be valid postfix the number of operations should be less the number of terms
      Parameters:
      s -
      Returns:
      true if the posfix is valid else false

    • checkNegBrackets

      public java.lang.String checkNegBrackets​(java.lang.String myString)
      It takes the string (infix) and validate if there are negative brackets it solves this problem using dummy zeros
      Parameters:
      myString -
      Returns:
      the string after solving the problem of negative brackets if found

    • validateString

      public boolean validateString​(java.lang.String s)
      Takes the string after we removed spaces in the infix form and validate it after we have solved problem of negative numbers and negative brackets using dummy zeros
      Parameters:
      s -
      Returns:
      true if the infix is valid else false

    • infixToPostfix

      public java.lang.String infixToPostfix​(java.lang.String expression)
      Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to postfix notation.there is no assumption on spaces between terms or the length of the term(e.g.,two digits symbolic or numeric term)
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • evaluate

      public int evaluate​(java.lang.String expression)
      Evaluate a postfix numeric expression,with a single space separator it throws exception if the method validatePostfix is false and in case of division by zero
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the expression evaluated value
